solution_line_template: One lesson lasts {hours_per_lesson} hours, so {total_hours} hours of them is {total_hours} / {hours_per_lesson} = <<{total_hours}/{hours_per_lesson}={num_lessons}>>{num_lessons} lessons.
If one lesson costs ${cost_per_lesson}, then {num_lessons} lessons cost {num_lessons} * {cost_per_lesson} = $<<{num_lessons}*{cost_per_lesson}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
